title: Dennis Austin, the software developer of PowerPoint, dies at 76
description: PowerPoint was the overhead projector’s digital successor. It became one of the most ubiquitous and scorned programs of modern office life.

title: 5th Circuit finds Biden White House, CDC violated First Amendment
description: The judges wrote that the White House, the Surgeon General, the CDC and the FBI likely “coerced the platforms to make their moderation decisions by way of intimidating messages and threats of adverse consequences.”

title: IRS to use AI to crack down on ultra-rich taxpayers and partnerships
description: IRS to use AI to crack down on ultra-rich taxpayers and partnerships.

title: Make sure you download the latest iPhone security update
description: Apple disclosed -- and closed -- security exploits that could put some high-profile users at risk. Keeping your phone’s software up to date can help.

title: Can’t watch ESPN? Try these alternatives to watch or listen to sports.
description: A blackout of TV channels for 15 million Spectrum cable customers is a glimpse at the pain coming for anyone who watches TV or streams.

title: Your Gmail and Instagram are training AI. There’s little you can do about it.
description: Tech companies are taking your conversations, photos and documents to teach their AI how to write, paint and pretend to be human.

title: Car makers can collect — and sell — too much data about you, watchdog says
description: Modern cars, equipped with the latest electronic gadgets that can record data automatically, are a “privacy nightmare,” the Mozilla Foundation report said.
